title: True damage vs Shields and such
body:
Since true damage is exactly that, does this also ignore any shields on the champion at the time?

So like {{summoner:21}} for example, it states that it "Shields your champion from 115-455 damage (depending on champion level) for 2 seconds.", but is this ignored by true damage? Also what about things like Karmas E or lux's prismatic barrier?
 
Then there is Blitzs passive, is that ignored by true damage when it gets activated?

replies.body:
As someone said before, true damage is defined as damage which cannot be reduced by any means. Invulnerabilities and untargetabilities are exceptions since those are a separate mechanic, but otherwise true damage has no 'special' interactions with shields. In other words, no, true damage does not pierce through/bypass health shields.
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

Some shields (ie {{champion:25}} ), shield only from specific damage.
In {{champion:25}}  case, magic damage, so true damage will ignore it.

True damage does not ignore shields; however, it ignores Magic Resist, Armor and damage reduction effects such as Alistar's ult and Braum's ice shield. Shields essentially function as extra hp, so I don't think there's anything in the game that ignores shields and goes straight for your actual HP.

Edit: Magic shields are an exception, as they only shield from magic damage.

true damage does not ignore shields, however things that do scaling damage depending on missing hp, like jinx's rocket or viegar's ult, don't factor shields in and often will just burst through things like barrier and shields because of the increased damage.
true damage cant go through shields only passed Armour and MR
